inventory.commentary: I wasn't completely sure what any examples I could find for Sense 3 actually meant, so this is the best I could do.

sense.name: (Cause to) form a layer or covering over.
sense.examples: Next, coat the cake with chocolate icing. Dirt coated her face. We coated the walls with nontoxic finishes. John coated the driveway with a thick layer of asphalt.

sense.name: COAT OUT: grow a coat of fur, as a dog might.
sense.examples: You never know how that breed will coat out. Rabbits coat out rather young.

sense.name: COAT OUT: accomplish a process or goal (by forming a coat over), as part of a more complex process.
sense.examples: Polymer should coat out as a binder for the cast-forming composition. They should coat out as a binder for the vinyl polymer. The Prozac sensitivity should coat out denuclearized secateurs.
